Definition: Percentage of babies with a healthy bithweight - a birthweight that lies between the 5th and 95th centile for weight at its gestational age
Source: Sourced from Public Health Scotland Open Data Portal

Definition: Percentage of Primary 1 school children with a healthy Body Mass Index (BMI) - BMI higher than 0.4th centile and less than 91st centile

Percentage of children in low income families - The number of children in families (not households), whereby income is less than 60% of median income Before Housing Costs (BHC) in both Absolute (2010 to 2011 index) and Relative terms derived from analyses of family income over the entire tax year.

Score based on the highest level of qualification achieved by school leavers, averaged across all leavers within a data zone. Using SCQF qualifications data for school leavers, the score is calculated by identifying the best level of qualification each pupil leaves school with.
Percentage of school leavers in positive and sustained destinations (follow up destination) - higher education, further education, employment, training, voluntary work or activity agreements

Percentage of the economically active population (aged 16-64) who are in employment -people are classed as in employment if they have done at least one hour of paid work in the week prior to their interview or if they have a job they are temporarily away from
The median earnings, in pounds, for employees living in the local authority area who are employed on adults rate of pay and whose pay was not affected by absence
Source: The Annual Survey of Hours and Earnings (ASHE)

Definition: Percentage of the population (aged 16 to 64 years) in receipt of out of work benefits - Job Seekers Allowance (JSA), Employment Support Allowance (ESA) & Incapacity, lone parents and other income related benefits. Please note - figures are a snapshot at May for the end fo the financial year, therefore 19/20 data caputres an uptick in OOWB related to Covid-19.

Proportion of newly born enterprises surviving 3 years - an enterprise is deemed to have survived if it is still active in terms of employment and/or turnover. Enterprises are included if they have survived for 3 years since the birth (beginning) of the enterprise
Source: Business Demography - Office for National Statistics (ONS)

Definition: Number of crimes per 10,000 population - crimes happening within 50 metres of a police station were removed to ensure this did not mask the level of crime happening in the neighbourhood of the police station

Number of dwelling fires per 100,000 population - takes into account both deliberate and accidental fires. Dwellings are buildings occupied by households, excluding hotels, hostels and residential institutions
Source: Provided directly by the Scottish Fire and Rescue Service

Definition: Carbon Dioxide (CO2) emissions per capita within the scope of influence of Local Authorities - allocated on an "end-user" basis where emissions are distributed according to the point of energy consumption (or point of emission if not energy related)
Source: Gov.UK - Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy

Definition: Number of emergency hospital admissions (for those aged 65+) per 100,000 population (aged 65+) - an emergency admission is defined as being a new continious spell of care in hospital where the patient was admitted as an emergency
Source: Provided directly by Public Health Scotland

Definition: Number of emergency department attendances per 100,000 population - only includes Emergency Departments, sites that provide 24-hour consultant led service. Minor injuries unit (MIU), small hospitals and health centres in rural areas that carry out emergency related activity and are GP or Nurse led are excluded
Source: Provided directly by Public Health Scotland

Definition: Number of European age standardised deaths for persons under 75 per 100,000 persons per year. PLEASE NOTE these are based on historic trends and do not take into account Covid-19 related deaths.

A combined index of three indicators; depopulation - the inverse of population change, Old Age Dependency Ratio - the ratio of older people (65 and over) to the working age population (16 to 64), and rural depopulation - the change in the proportion of the population living in rural or rural remote areas. A rising index indicates an increasingly fragile demographic.
Source: The index is calculated by the Improvement Service using population estimates from National Records of Scotland (NRS)

Definition: Average of estimates of: life satisfaction, feeling that the things done in life are worthwhile, happiness, and anxiety. Higher scores indicate greater levels of well-being.

Percentage of households in fuel poverty. Prior to 2018 this was where one tenth of household income was spent on fuel costs. From 2018 this has been updated to include a narrower focus so that, as well as the above definition, only those whose income after fuel costs is insufficient to maintain an acceptable standard of living. Rates after 2018 are therefore not comparable with previous years.
